product_overview: Nim is a modern, personal website template built with Next.js 15 and React 19, featuring Tailwind CSS styling, MDX content management, advanced UI components, and WebGL integration.
core_goals: Provide a flexible and customizable personal website framework for portfolios, blogs, and projects.
Deliver a performant, accessible, and visually engaging user experience with animations and 3D content.
Support content management via MDX for blogs and structured data files for projects and experience.
Enable easy theming with light/dark mode and responsive design for all device types.
Incorporate robust analytics and newsletter subscription for user engagement tracking.
key_features: Advanced audio player component with interactive UI, keyboard controls, and animations.
Dynamic project management system showcasing projects with videos and detailed case-study pages.
Interactive and customizable video player components with hover effects and autoplay.
Sophisticated motion-driven UI components and animation system using Framer Motion.
Three.js based 3D WebGL components for immersive graphical content.
Rich interactive UI elements like carousels, accordions, magnetic effects, and morphing dialogs.
Comprehensive text effects including scrambling, morphing, looping, and circular text displays.
MDX-based blog system with custom components and metadata support.
Detailed analytics integration with Vercel and Google Analytics.
Newsletter subscription functionality with server API integration.
Responsive navigation system with theme switching support and accessibility.
Portfolio archive with filtering and category support.
Dynamic page generation for SEO, icons, metadata, and structured data.
Dedicated about page with biography and work experience details.
Visual progress and scroll tracking indicators.
Complete testing infrastructure with Jest and React Testing Library.
Core UI library built on Radix UI primitives for consistency and accessibility.
Utility libraries for helper functions, constants, and hooks.
user_flow_summary: Users land on the main page and navigate via header to projects, blog, archive, and about sections.
Users browse project showcases with video thumbnails and can view detailed case studies.
Users read blog posts authored in MDX format with enhanced text and code components.
Users interact with audio and video players featuring keyboard and hover controls.
Users can sign up for newsletters via a subscription form interfaced with backend APIs.
Users navigate the site via responsive header and footer menus with theme switcher.
Analytics track user interactions and site performance unobtrusively.
Developers add content using structured data files and MDX posts, with fast local development and build commands.
validation_criteria: All UI components function correctly with full accessibility and keyboard support.
Animations run smoothly across devices without performance degradation.
3D WebGL content centers properly and performs well on mobile and desktop.
Blog posts render MDX and metadata correctly with syntax highlighting.
Project and archive filters display accurate and expected results with no errors.
Newsletter subscriptions successfully trigger backend API calls and store user data securely.
The site builds and deploys successfully with no ESLint errors or warnings.
Analytics capture and report data accurately without impacting site speed.
Tests cover critical components and functionalities with passing Jest results.
Theme switching toggles between light and dark modes consistently across pages.
